title: Perma Banned for cussing no more than a day after people spamming "Die Korean" for an entire match
body:
Just as the title says, some arguing and a few cusswords result in a permanent banning no more than a day after someone spammed "Die Koreans" "Die Chinese" repeatedly through the entirety of prematch and all game. Not to mention the constant bombardment of hate speech, foul mouthed talking about my mother and family. An absolute joke. Absolutely no notice of them being banned (as was typical the handful of times people I reported actually got punished). Riot may as well just dig in my pocket and steal from me. 9 out of every 10 games have people leaving, afking or spending the entirety of the match spouting homophobic or racial slurs and they take no issue with that. 
Absolute rip-off.
DO NOT INVEST ANY MONEY IN THIS GAME.
Play something else where you won't have to listen to vile hatred being spewed and they can't just absolutely steal product from you when they deem your cusswords too offensive cause some hateful troll wants to punish you for arguing back at them. I received the same language and treatment as I was giving out I just didn't file a ticket because I know nothing ever happens. 
Do not waste your money. Do not waste your time.

replies.body:
Each person is responsible for their own behavior. Instead of joining them in a shouting contest, mute, report, and move on.

> I received the same language and treatment as I was giving out I just didn't file a ticket because I know nothing ever happens.

You just got done saying that you were perma-banned. Reports do cause a review of behavior.
So, why isn't them muting me a solution for them as opposed to me permanently losing my account?

Because the damage is done once they've read your comment.
Muting is a last resort to prevent further damage.

Just because we have fire hydrants it doesn't mean house fires are OK.
Because you're responsible for your own behavior.

cos you are punished for your own behavioral history.

If you've gotten to the point of being permabanned, it either means you were consistently toxic or you used a ton of hate speech / homophobic slurs / telling others to harm themselves.

Eitherway, go play something else, Riot doesn't want you in their game.

Ah. Okay. So I'm just as bad as someone spewing racial slurs or wishing death upon a nation of people. Makes total sense. After years and years with this game and a shameful investment of money some cussing disallows me from playing something I paid for, even in private custom matches. I bet the anti Korean player is still playing though, despite me reporting them. Cause why not right?

I'm not condoning what they said, I'm telling you to

**_REPORT_**. **_THEM_**.

Mute them if necessary to prevent yourself from getting into a flaming match with them.

Well, it makes it valid as no other company seems to have the right to take a product you purchase away from you due to misconduct. At the very least let's make the punishments balanced no? I would like to know that the people I have reported for using racial and homophobic slurs or aggressively telling people to kill themselves have been banned permanently as well.
Certainly, those sorts of things should have a zero tolerance response. 

If I am responsible for my behavior, than they should be held responsible for theirs. Ban their accounts as well and I will accept that my punishment is balanced as well. 
Why is blatant racism and literally telling people to "kill yourself" tolerable? At all?

>Well, it makes it valid as no other company seems to have the right to take a product you purchase away from you due to misconduct. 

Your purchases are an agreement with Riot that they will let you have access to their content so long as they think you're following the ToS.

>At the very least let's make the punishments balanced no? I would like to know that the people I have reported for using racial and homophobic slurs or aggressively telling people to kill themselves have been banned permanently as well.

Racial slurs and telling people to kill themselves already often get escalated punishments (14-day or permaban for the first offense is not unusual). I can't comment on your case because I neither know what was in your chat log nor do I know what step of the punishment ladder you were on previously.

>If I am responsible for my behavior, than they should be held responsible for theirs. Ban their accounts as well and I will accept that my punishment is balanced as well.

If you reported them, then it's the system's job.

>Why is blatant racism and literally telling people to "kill yourself" tolerable? At all?

It's not.

Seems as though it is acceptable considering I never received a notice after reporting them that action was taken, which has been the case the very few times before that something was actually done.

Their system is a joke.

The notice system is lackluster and often is picky when sending out the notifications of punishments. Sometimes you only get one when it's your report specifically that was the last straw to send them a punishment verdict.

Given that their behavior included a bunch of racial slurs, you might only get the notification once their ban has been reviewed and escalated.

Ultimately, the notification is not a good indication if someone you reported was punished or not.

Regardless, they have no insured that I will never spend a cent on any product produced by their company or that is in anyway affiliated. On top of that, I will make certain to let everyone know that they condone racism, homophobia and actions that incite or encourage violence against groups and/or oneself without punishment. In addition to that, I will encourage people to most certainly NEVER spend money on their product as it can and likely will be taken away from them for actions far less inflammatory. 
Riot Games: Turning a blind eye to bigotry and punishing those who respond to people who spew inflammatory filth at you. In other words, just sit and read the absolute garbage people spew at you (which you CANNOT mute pregame, or postgame) and don't defend yourself or others because that same hateful troll will report you.
I am under no delusion that I can make any sort of dent in their business but I assure you, I will cost them money. The climate here is not very tolerant at all of bigots, or those who who turn a blind eye to it. 
DO NOT invest in the product. Use it for free and put your money into other businesses.

I'm pretty sure that they're aware that customers who are perma-banned might spread their dissatisfaction of the company. They understand this risk and decided that perma-banning players that behave poorly in some combination of frequency and severity is still better for the game.

You claim that Riot condones racism, but if you look at this section of the boards you'll see several cases where a person's punishment was escalted for racism, bigotry, or telling someone to kill themselves. So that statement is just blatantly _**false**_.

You'd have me fooled with the vast majority of every game I play involving hate speech at some point or another. They most certainly do NOT police that at all. The community is vile and toxic and the amount of absolutely deplorable speech I've read is beyond counting. Pregame lobbies, post game and very often through out the entire match. There is no way they are punishing these people. Period.

Literally just a few threads below yours is a person complaining about their ban escalation when they told someone to kill themselves.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/aVs9ZddN-what-is-wrong-with-the-report-system

One person of the hundreds, or thousands. Forget escalation. I wanna know the justification for banning me for using the "f" word but nothing being done to the seemingly endless throngs of people spewing racial and homophobic slurs? How is that balanced? 
Who thinks those two things are even remotely related?
How do you take something I've invested money in for me simply cussing? Words that other players can easily filter out? When not only that they can just turn my chat off? 
I didn't, and certainly never have, used any hate speech or encouraged or wished harm on anyone else.
How is that balanced?

>One person of the hundreds, or thousands. Forget escalation.

I presented you one person, if you would take the time to look at the boards you'll see that case is not an unusual situation.

> wanna know the justification for banning me for using the "f" word 

Show your chat logs in their entirety if you want me to judge what you said.

>but nothing being done to the seemingly endless throngs of people spewing racial and homophobic slurs?

I just got done proving to you that Riot does do something about it.

>Words that other players can easily filter out? 

If you are to follow your own logic, you could easily filter out what other players have said before you incriminated yourself.

>When not only that they can just turn my chat off?

Riot already tried that. Didn't work. People who had poor enough behavior to land themselves as far as a perma-ban did not stop behaving poorly just because chat was turned off for them. They would often start behaving poorly via other means like trolling.
